solution.text:
In the following cases:
  • \(H_2 (g) + \frac{1}{2} O_2 (g) \rightarrow H_2O (l)\) : The reactants are gases and the product is a liquid. Since gases are in a higher state of disorder than liquids, the entropy of the given system is decreasing.
  • \(2Cl (g) \rightarrow Cl_2 (g)\) : One mole of \(Cl_2\) has a lower entropy than two moles of \(Cl\). Therefore, the entropy of the given system is decreasing.
  • A solid melts to become a liquid : Liquids are in a higher state of disorder than solids. Therefore, the entropy of the given system is increasing.
  • A substance increases its temperature by 20K : As the substance is heated, the constituent particles are in a greater state of motion and disorder. Therefore, the entropy of the given system is increasing.
  • A solid sublimes : As the solid sublimes to a gas, it goes into a higher state of disorder. Therefore, the entropy of the given system is increasing.
